entry.title: Constant 0CASH for Ledger !* does not contain any value. Message No. GLT2301
entry.content:
Dear All Members,

I'm facing a problem regarding the creation process of Goods Receipt from Production order for a fixed material. While trying to generate the Goods Receipt, the following errors are seen:

"Constant 0CASH for Ledger !* does not contain any value. Message No. GLT2301"

I need help to resolve the issue.

Thank you

entry.title: Issue with Cost Center linked to incorrect Profit Center in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (3SL, CBC)
entry.content:
Dear SAP community,

We are working with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (3SL, CBC) and created a cost center ES015393 in the Manage Cost Centers Fiori app. During its creation, it was accidentally linked to the wrong profit center ES015394.

SAP Support advised us to:

  • Create a new cost center and link it to the correct profit center. 

  • Align the valid-from date of the new cost center with the valid-to date of the incorrect one. 

However, this did not resolve the issue.

Problem:

When creating new asset postings for the corrected cost center, we face the error: “Cost center has different profit centers; therefore it cannot be used.”

This happens when creating a fixed asset and filling the cost center field in the Manage Fixed Assets app. According to SAP Support, the only current alternative is to create different cost centers for each profit center and use those in Asset Accounting (AA).

Challenge:

Each cost center/profit center represents one of our locations. Our cost center structure is integrated across our organization (HR system, CRM, etc.). Creating a completely new cost center number is not a feasible option.

References checked:

  • Asset Accounting – Time-Dependent Master Data (SAP Help)

  • SAP Note 3576469 – Error message ‘Cost center has different profit centers’

Question:
Has anyone faced this or a similar scenario before? If so, how did you resolve it while keeping the cost center structure intact?

 

Thanks in advance for your support!

 

Best Regards,


Mike van Ingen
Finance

entry.title: Re: Hyperlinks removed following upgrade to SP5 P100

entry.title: Re: Tax Allowance in Depreciation for Malaysia
entry.content:
Hello @S0027169027 

Thank you for your follow-up,

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, it is recommended to use the standard depreciation keys provided for book purposes. Meanwhile, Malaysia’s capital allowance should be managed separately within the Local Tax depreciation area, specifically Depreciation Area 15.

Since custom depreciation keys cannot be generated in Public Cloud, the advised approach is:

  • Ensure book depreciation aligns with standard keys.
  • Manually post the 20% Initial Allowance in the first year using the Post Depreciation app.
  • Record the 10–20% Annual Allowance in subsequent years in a similar manner.

This ensures compliance with Malaysia’s capital allowance regime while maintaining the system's clean core and clearly separating book and tax values.

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Reporting for Onboarding 2.0
entry.content: Hi Blanca, We use story reports and it works very well.

entry.title: Re: Replenishment from bulk issue partial qty not allowed...
entry.content:
Okay I understand that error you're encountering—"Partial quantity withdrawal - Partial quant. in stor. type Y042 not allowed"—is tied to SAP EWM's configuration for storage type Y042, which explicitly disallows partial pallet withdrawals

You can troubleshoot with below mentioned steps

Check Quant Details in Y042, Use /SCWM/MON or /SCWM/QUAN to inspect the quant in Y042.

Confirm that the quant is indeed a full pallet and not split across multiple quants or partially reserved.

Verify Storage Type Settings, Go to /SCWM/WMST and check the configuration for Y042.
Ensure that the setting "Partial Quant Allowed" is unchecked, which matches your business rule.

If you want to allow partial withdrawals temporarily, you can enable this setting—but only if it aligns with your operational needs.

Review Warehouse Process Type, Check the process type used for replenishment (via /SCWM/PROCPTYPE). Ensure it’s configured to handle full pallet movements and doesn’t trigger partial withdrawals inadvertently.

Hope this helped you

entry.title: Quation Method Currency Exchange Rates
entry.content:
Hi, 

We have a customer who has been running on public cloud since June 2025.

They are now encountering issues during revaluation due to the use of indirect/direct quotation of exchange rates, as the calculation is not exactly the same. I'm wondering if we could change the quotation method from indirect to direct, even though they have already been using the system for a while? Or is this a change that cannot be made, considering they already have a large number of transactions in their system?

Thanks in advance, 

Sanne

entry.title: Accelerating Industry 4.0 roadmap with SAP intelligent best practices across 4 strategic ROI pillars
entry.content:
Introduction

SAP’s Industry 4.0 strategy & intelligent best practices empowers companies to evolve from isolated manufacturing automation to a holistic, competitive business strategy. On 6 November, we’ll showcase the latest SAP intelligent best practices within 4 strategic business value pillars, based on actual client use cases from e.g. Enexis, Swiss Railway, SBB. Each intelligent client use case (using AI / IoT) is designed to help businesses become more agile, resilient, customer-centric and profitable. These 4 strategic business value pillars are:

  1. Intelligent product & Solutions – Servitization – a key trend supported with “as-a-Service” models incl. solution bundles priced with “pay-per-use” subscription models, infused with Business AI & IoT in SAP private (BRIM) and public cloud (solution orders)
  2. Intelligent Factories & Supply Chain – AI-Driven Integrated Business Planning (IBP) with new AI enhancements across the business network and Edge devices.
  3. Intelligent Assets – OT/IT Enabled predictive maintenance (APM) AI strategies with the new market leading Cumulocity OT/IT edge platform.
  4. Intelligent collaborative Industry 4.0 Roadmap – Enexis roadmap for the next 18 months is Leading the Way to the future.

We’ll evaluate how these 4 strategic pillars contribute to an integrated Industry 4.0 roadmap to drive digital business transformation using the latest innovative SAP / AI / IoT platforms, SAP best practices and industry 4.0 solutions. The industry 4.0 roadmap can also be the basis for the benefits case of the S/4 HANA and GEN AI transformation program.

 

Pillar 1: Intelligent Products / Solutions = Servitization by outcome based solution bundles

Modern products are evolving into smart, customizable, and service-enabled solutions. SAP supports this servitization shift through two platforms:

  • SAP BRIM (Billing and Revenue Innovation Management) (based on SAP Cloud ERP Private)
  • SAP Cloud ERP (Public Cloud) incl. Solution Order and SAP Subscription Billing

The details of the client use case will be provided

 
Both platforms enable usage-based business models, bundling products and services into flexible offerings that drive recurring revenue and deeper customer engagement. Key topics covered:
  • Comparison of subscription-based billing options in SAP BRIM (private cloud) vs. SAP Cloud ERP (Solution Order) and SAP Subscription Billing (public cloud)
  • Business impact of Outcome-Based Contracts (OBCs), potentially increasing recurring revenue by 20–30%
  • The objectives of the SAP servitization strategy
  • Increased revenue by additional OPEX offerings and building long term customer relationships.

Further reading / information:

  • Solution Business Video
  • What is Solution Business - SAP News article
  • Solution Order Demo Video
  • Impact of Servitization on SAP Enterprise Architecture
  • Pay-per-Use and SAP Cloud Architecture
  • VNSG Round Table on Servitization Roadmaps
  • Impact SMART product configurators on enterprise architecture
  • Business Model Innovation Management in a SAP environment
  • Servitization round-table; Companies are struggling with their servitization roadmap
  • Servitization solution architecture workshop with SAP and Microsoft

Pillar 2: Intelligent Factories & Supply Chain = AI-Driven Integrated Business Planning

SAP’s Integrated Business Planning (IBP) transforms the digital supply chain agility into a competitive advantage.

 
A key AI feature is Inventory Optimization Analysis, which:
  • Summarizes key drivers behind safety stock recommendations
  • Highlights demand variability, lead time fluctuations, and planner deviations
  • Translates complex calculations into human-readable insights
  • Business networks to align the E2E supply chain
  • Benefits by increased SCM agility and reduced logistic costs

Benefits of the AI features:

  • Accelerates analysis and adoption of planning outputs
  • Aligns inventory decisions with strategic goals for working capital and customer service

The details of the Swiss Railway use case will be provided

Further reading:

  1. IBP for MRO Supply – VNSG Workshop
  2. Smart Factory Solution Architecture – VNSG Workshop
  3. Impact of the digital twin on the Solution architecture

Pillar 3: Intelligent Assets = IT/OT Edge-Enabled predictive maintenance strategies

SAP Asset Performance Management (APM) empowers EAM companies to shift from reactive to predictive maintenance strategies. By leveraging AI and IoT sensor data, APM helps minimize asset failure risks and enables faster, more accurate decision-making.

 
To support this transformation, SAP is embedding the market leading Cumulocity OT/IT edge platform into APM, enabling:
  • Simplified connectivity to diverse IoT data sources—smart sensors, edge devices, data lakes, flat files, and more
  • Advanced device management directly within SAP APM
  • Real-time asset health monitoring using AI and rule-based anomaly detection from streaming sensor data

The integration of SAP AI Core further enhances predictive maintenance by detecting anomalies in equipment behavior—without requiring data science expertise. Reliability engineers can deploy AI models that learn from historical sensor data and generate alerts for potential failures.

Real-world examples of anomaly detection include:

  • Beverage production line: filling valve failures
  • Mining operations: clogged air filters on trucks
  • Oil & gas: electric motor anomalies on rotating equipment

The details of the Bayer use case will be provided

Further reading:

  1. SAP APM + Cumulocity Integration
  2. VNSG AI Congress – Industry 4.0 at the Edge
  3. Impact of the digital twin on the Solution architecture
  4. The integration platform within a hybrid application landscape

Pillar 4 Industry 4.0 platform at Enexis = Utilities Leading the Way

On 6 November, the Enexis innovation team will present a deep dive into their R&D initiatives, showcasing how digital innovation is accelerating the transition to a smarter, faster, and more sustainable energy system.

 
The multidisciplinary team at Enexis is building and testing impactful digital solutions that directly influence the SAP solution architecture and AI roadmap.What to expect:
  • Hands-on demos of prototypes like BMR 2.0 and XR applications
  • Initiatives such as Digital4All, the AI Speeltuin, and the Roboticalab
  • Smart use of computer vision and Generative AI
  • End-to-end process automation and secure document access via the Enexis Document Store
  • Integrated SAP solution architecture and AI roadmap

Further reading:

  1. VNSG Focus Group – Intelligent Industry 4.0 Roadmap
  2. LinkedIn Updates – Enexis Innovation

Getting Started with Industry 4.0 roadmap

SAP offers a comprehensive portfolio of services to simplify and accelerate your Industry 4.0 journey. These include:

  • Libraries of best practices and preconfigured industry 4.0 solutions
  • Flexible deployment options and integrated business content
  • Regional Innovation Hubs with live factory setups to visualize high-value use cases

These resources help organizations across industries turn Industry 4.0 ambitions into tangible outcomes. Supported by an Enterprise Architecture Framework, AI data governance and Value Lifecycle management.

Further reading:

  1. Industry 4.0: The Future of Manufacturing | SAP
  2. SAP Industry 4.0 Strategy Overview
  3. The impact of Industry 4.0 on the enterprise architecture
  4. Solution Architecture 4 Agile SAP S/4 HANA platform

Enroll at VNSG site; www.vnsg.nl (events)

Like IT when you like IT

entry.title: Re: Replenishment from bulk issue partial qty not allowed...
entry.content:
Also you can Go to /SCWM/REPL and review the strategy assigned to Y052.
Make sure it’s set to trigger full pallet replenishment and not based on quantity thresholds that could cause partial picks.

Check the product EWMS4-42 in /SCWM/MAT1.
Ensure that palletization data and unit of measure settings are consistent with full pallet handling.

Try creating a manual warehouse task for 1 full pallet from Y042 to Y052. If successful, it confirms the issue is with the replenishment logic rather than quant availability.
If these steps don’t resolve the issue, then you have to review the EWM configuration

entry.title: 'Build Your First App with CAP' bookshop tutorial : Deploy to BTP Cloud Foundry fails (mbt build)
entry.content:
Hi,

I was following the jumpstart bookshop tutorial 'Build Your First App with CAP':
https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/get-started/in-a-nutshell#jumpstart

After I got a workaround for a bug of the Fiori bookshop sample (see https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/cap-build-your-first-app-with-cap-bookshop-tutorial-sap-fiori-ui-does-not/qaq-p/14231262), I have the bookshop sample running on localhost.

Now I want to deploy the full-stack CAP application on BTP, Cloud Foundry runtime, as described here:
https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/guides/deployment/to-cf

Steps I followed:

  1. Prerequisites, all done => https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/guides/deployment/to-cf#prerequisites
  2. Prepare for Production, steps below done => https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/guides/deployment/to-cf#prepare-for-production
    • Step 1. (cds add hana)
    • Step 2. (cds add xsuaa)
    • Step 3. (cds add mta)
    • Step 5. (cds add workzone)
  3. Build and Deploy section => https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/guides/deployment/to-cf#build-and-deploy
    • cf login step, done
    • cds up => this command resulted in the following error (entire console output at the bottom in [1])

[2025-10-01 15:47:14] INFO executing the "npm run build" command...
npm error Missing script: "build"
npm error
npm error To see a list of scripts, run:
npm error npm run

make: *** [bookstoreadminauthors] Error 1
[2025-10-01 15:47:14] ERROR could not build the MTA project: could not execute the "make -f Makefile_20251001154658.mta p=cf mtar=mta.tar strict=true mode= t=\"gen\"" command: exit status 2

Command failed: mbt build -t gen --mtar mta.tar

Thank you, if someone has an idea what is wrong here and how fix it

Additional remark:
The "mbt build" works if I skip step 5. (cds add workzone) in the above 'Prepare for Production' steps

mbt build -t gen --mtar mta.tar

entry.title: From Novice to Confident Trader: The CLT Academy Journey
entry.content:
In the fast-paced world of financial markets, aspiring traders often feel lost — bombarded with strategies, advice, and tools, yet unsure which path actually works. CLT Academy positions itself as the guiding light in this chaos, promising not just lessons, but a transformation of mindset, skill, and consistency.

A Philosophy Rooted in Clarity, Confidence & Commitment

What stands out first is CLT’s emphasis on clarity — not just showing how trades are done, but explaining why. Their approach appears to be grounded in building understanding from the ground up, resisting the temptation of flashy shortcuts. They back this with a promise of lifetime mentorship and continuous support, suggesting they want students not just to get started, but to evolve steadily over time.

They claim over five years of experience, more than 30,000 students trained, and thousands of live sessions delivered. Their narrative underscores results, accountability, and practical systems.

Courses & Curriculum: A Structured Roadmap

CLT Academy offers a suite of signature programs aimed at traders at different stages. Some highlights include:

  • Trade Craft: A course that focuses on the foundational elements — reading charts, understanding candlesticks, learning key structures in the market.

  • Profit Matrix: Aimed at scaling, this course introduces pro tools, real-time entry points, and systematic setups.

  • Market Code: Delving into structural market behavior, reversals, smart money concepts, and risk frameworks.

  • CLT Vantage: A more advanced course where you shape your own strategy, solidify risk management, and execute trades with clarity.

Each course is nested within a broader process: awareness and planning → foundational setup → execution & growth → consistency & mastery. This scaffolding suggests that students aren’t thrown into deep waters too soon; instead, they climb steadily.

Beyond the Curriculum: Tools, Community & Support

CLT doesn’t limit itself to video lessons alone. They provide supplementary tools such as trading journals, precision indicators, and calculators (for risk, profit, pivot points, etc.). These are designed to help traders quantify performance, refine strategy, and maintain discipline.

Critically, the promise of lifetime mentorship—ongoing access to guidance, live market calls, weekly reviews, and strategy updates — sets them apart from many “course-only” offerings. They also run a Discord trade channel to keep traders engaged, accountable, and learning together.

Who Might Benefit Most?

CLT’s model seems best suited for:

  • Beginners who wish to learn systematically rather than by trial and error.

  • Intermediate traders who feel stuck and seek structured feedback and mentorship.

  • People who believe trading is more than just technique — that mindset, discipline, and community are essential.

  • Traders willing to commit long term, rather than chasing quick fixes.

It may be less suited for those looking for ultra-fast results or “get rich quick” promises. The strength of CLT lies in building consistency, not hype.

Challenges & Considerations

  • Transparency & Track Record: While CLT cites large numbers (students trained, profits booked), prospective students should verify through independent reviews, testimonials, or trial access where possible.

  • Course vs. Coaching: The leap from understanding to executing in live markets is steep. The mentorship claims help, but execution still depends heavily on the learner’s discipline and emotional control.

  • Cost vs. Value: Advanced trading education is rarely cheap. It’s vital that students assess whether the offerings align with their budget, time commitment, and expected returns.

  • Market Risk: No amount of training can eliminate risk in financial markets. Losses are inevitable; what matters is risk control, resilience, and psychological stability.

Conclusion: A Path, Not a Shortcut

CLT Academy frames itself not just as a school, but as a trading ecosystem: curriculum, community, tools, and long-term support combined. For those willing to put in the work, it offers a structured path from confusion to confidence. The key question for any prospective student is not merely what they will learn, but how committed they are to applying, iterating, and growing. In the realm of trading, where uncertainty is the norm, that consistency may be the most valuable “course” of all.

entry.title: coming soon: Sales Processes in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION:

The first Activity of this Academic Lesson introduces the basic B2B order-to-cash processes and demonstrates how an ERP system facilitates these processes. The Learning Journey of this Activity also explains the foundational concepts of cloud computing. The second Activity dives deeper into how typical sales transactions are processed in an ERP, specifically SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and how AI assists in the day-to-day sales processes and analysis.  

SUGGESTED AREAS OF STUDY:

Business (all majors), Information Systems, and other areas of study that teach sales processes or ERP systems. Appropriate for students at undergraduate and graduate level university, community college, trade school and upper-level secondary school.  

KEYWORDS:

Sales processes, business processes, business transactions, ERP, SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Cloud computing, risk assessment, embedded AI

DOWNLOAD:

Microsoft Word (editable) format: coming soon 

PDF (non-edible) format: coming soon

UPDATED:  September 2025

entry.title: Exploring CDS based Analytical Models with the Relation Explorer - analytical view/perspective
entry.content:
Relation explorer analytical view / analytical perspective makes it easy to get an overview of the analytical model with very less clicks. No need to open all the views to understands details.

We start small , looking to a branch of a star schema , dimension Connection ( /DMO/ANA_I_Connection ) which is part of the flight data model.  After calling the relation explorer we see the Relation Explorer Tab in the below section of the screenshot.

Relation Explorer tab shows:

  • in the left pane the associations from the dimension to other CDS views over all levels are visualizes . It starts fully expanded!
    next to the CDS view name we see the view type. E.g. /DMO/ANA_I_CARRIER is of type [Dimension]
  • in the right pane one can see all the elements of current view. As /DMO/ANA_I_Connection is selected all elements of this dimension are displayed.
    • One can select (single click) any other view e.g. /DMO/ANA_I_CARRIER and the right pane get updated with the elements of that view.
    • double clicking the view will directly open the view 
  • the right pane displays all elements grouped by roles.
    • In this example we have 2 keys and e.g. expanding AirlineID show label and additional details about association and InfoObject. In case of compounded parent we would have seen the Parent element.
    • double clicking AirlineID highlight the element in the source ( see line 21 )
    • [Text] gives a hint that AirlineID has text, this is missing for ConnetionID -> no Text supported
    • Attributes list all dimension attributes. Last one, DistanceUnit is a Unit element.
    • the Unit group show all unit related elements.
    • other group are shown if relevant.

One can also start the analytical Relation Explorer based on query or cube view.
In both cases the cube view is opened and visualizes the cube with all associations .

We change focus and look to the example of a query - starting relation explorer shows the cube definition including dimension Connection from above.

with one view

  • in the left pane we get all associations visualizes. View names are shown with the view types
  • in the right pane we can see all 13 dimensions of the cube and get if dimension support Text, have Attributes or Hierarchies
    • from 1st screenshot we already know that Text, Attributes and Hierarchies are available for AirlineID
    • expanding ConnectionID show that it is compounded to AirlineID
  • we see all 5 measures with additional details like aggregation method and unit
  • with " Units (2) " we see the unit related dimensions. This section only list those dimension that are unit relevant.  Expanding the dimension like CurrencyCode lists all related measures. 
    ( Both dimension are also listed in dimension section. )
  • for time based dimension one can directly understand the base dimension and wherefrom it is derived without looking into the source ( see below snippet with FiscalYearMonth )

 

How to start the Relation Explorer

call relation explorer to see the view

right click somewhere in the CDS view 

( in case of CDS view type cube, dimension or query the analytical view is the default view )

  • If the view is not shown, choose Configure Context and activate it.
  • one can switch any time to different perspective / context if needed

 

 

 

Release Info:  analytical view / analytical perspective started with

  • BW/4HANA 2023 FP 04 
  • S/4HANA Public Cloud and Privat Cloud OP2023

entry.title: Crystal Reports Designer 2020 Showing Ruler in cm Page Setup in Inches
entry.content:
I've spent over an hour with both Copilot and Gemini AI and all state the same thing.  My Regional Format is set to United States.  My "Windows Display Language" is set to Canada.  Under control panel, Region, the format shows United States, Additional Settings shows Measurement System to to "U.S.".  

If I open ANY other application, the rulers are all imperial, which I want, since it's ingrained that a page is 8.5 inches.  

Why is Crystal confused as to what the measurements should be?  If the File > Page Setup shows "Inches" then should the ruler not match?  My windows display needs to be Canada and there are no other places to set measurement so Crystal is the issue.

entry.title: Re: Dive into the future of SAP Universal ID and understand the changes underway

Hello @bharatbajaj,

Please try the following steps to unlink the unnecessary identities:

  1. Under Identities tab, select the P-user which you would like to unlink from the UID account
  2. Click the three dots button in the top right window and then choose "Unlink Identity"
  3. Confirm the pop-up and the P-user should be unlinked.

entry.title: Re: Message and Header exchange from Child to Parent flows
entry.content:
Hi Aananda,

Sorry for the delay in response.

Thanks for the details. Now I understand that you are only experiencing this issue when the child flow fails. This is the intended behavior as the child process couldn't complete. Hence, details were not persisted. If you would like to propagate header as well as payload(custom exception) from exception subprocess to main iFlow, you need to replace Error end in exception subprocess to Message end.

The drawback of this approach would be that child iFlow would appear as Completed in message monitoring.

Thanks!

Kind regards,

Shweta

entry.title: Re: Enhancements to SAP Community - September 2025
entry.content:
That’s a very clear and well-thought-out update, and from a technical and community management perspective, it makes a lot of sense. Excessive tagging is often treated as a quick visibility hack, but it comes with several downsides:

  1. Search & Indexing Efficiency – Fewer, more precise tags reduce noise in the internal search engine. When each piece of content has dozens of tags, search relevance drops and indexing systems struggle to rank results properly.

  2. Notification Overload – The limit on SAP Managed Tags, user tags, and labels helps avoid unnecessary notifications for irrelevant content. Technically, this reduces background load on subscription/notification services as well, since fewer tags mean fewer triggered alerts.

  3. Content Discoverability – Over-tagging dilutes context. By enforcing a maximum, the system ensures that metadata is more meaningful. This improves navigation for end users and enhances the performance of recommendation algorithms that rely on tags and labels.

  4. System Integrity & Consistency – From a backend standpoint, restricting tags prevents database bloat. Unlimited or excessive tagging often leads to redundant, duplicate, or misspelled entries, which makes it harder to maintain a clean taxonomy.

  5. Future-Proofing – With SAP Managed Tags tied to an official taxonomy, limiting the total encourages contributors to align content with strategic categories. This not only improves discoverability today but also ensures cleaner migration and scaling in future platform updates.

In short, this change isn’t just about reducing clutter — it’s a structural adjustment that balances user experience, backend efficiency, and long-term taxonomy health. Members who apply tags thoughtfully will see higher engagement because their content will surface to the right audience instead of being buried in irrelevant feeds.

Would you like me to also draft a best practices checklist for contributors (like “choose 1–3 SAP tags, avoid duplicates, use descriptive labels”) that you could share with your team/community for smoother adoption of this new tagging policy?

Thank you providing such insights through this forum https://community.sap.com/t5/what-s-new /buy to let enhancements-to-sap-community-september-2025/ba-p/14231974

Building on that, this policy also encourages contributors to think critically about the true focus of their content instead of relying on tag spamming for visibility. It fosters a more disciplined publishing culture where precision is valued over volume. Over time, this will strengthen the quality of metadata across the platform, making both search and filtering more accurate. Ultimately, the change benefits not only the platform’s technical performance but also the community’s overall trust and satisfaction.

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Error during the Migration of...
entry.content:
Hello @LukasKuhn 

Thank you for your follow-up and for sharing the screenshot that clarifies it.

The notes displayed in Manage Business Partner (F3163) → Basic Data are Business Partner texts, specifically text objects like BUT000. That is why Text ID 0002 Accounting note functions correctly when added manually there. SAP Support Portal-3326351 - Error "Text Object BUT000 Does not Exist" occurs in Fiori App Manage Business Partner Master Data

KNA1 is the general Customer text object; posting to KNA1 wouldn’t appear in BP Basic Data

If you need further support, do let me know

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: New Developer Forums!

Thank you Thank you Thank you for making not only an explicit integration forum but also not limiting it to SAP Integration Suite as I literally live in the integration space.  Also thank you for building what looks to be some great forums that are well thought out and were desperately needed.  I give whomever came up with all of this at least a 9.5 out of 10 for well thought out forums that make sense and will make it far easier to find answers.

I do agree with @anantkamal that existing forum posts in forums that aren't part of this new grouping need to be gone through and things moved to the new forums.  Yes it will be a pain, but it will be worth it.  SAP has done a lot of great work with SCN, especially with adding moderators and giving them power to delete posts from years ago in the wild wolly SDN days that were nothing more than posts to get points to go to Tech-Ed for free - I'm glad those days are over because  trying to read groups with those things in them was exhausting and made it virtually impossible to follow most groups.  I get that there are some FAQ questions but if I see another post on what is the transaction to view a sales order I will scream.

I go back to when I first started with SAP 20 years ago when we purchase it and in those days it was SDN and what SCN has become is fantastic and much improved.

entry.title: About CDP Monitoring tool
entry.content:
1. Action from the custom connector is not fetching activity data when we run from the playground
2. We found that successful actions logs are not showing detailed activation payload.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: About CDP Monitoring tool
entry.content:
a) Action from the custom connector is not fetching activity data when we run from the playground

This is correct. As per documentation Actions playground the activity is not included in records from playground.


b) We found that successful actions logs are not showing detailed activation payload. - If this note is related to CDP Monitoring tool, please review documentation Monitoring dashboard

Specifically, for Activation monitoring dashboard there is action message details page where customers can get a detailed overview of an error or discarded message and its occurrences.

After selecting an error or discarded message from the Action Failures, Discarded, Attempted Retries message table, or the Logs table, a screen opens providing a detailed overview of the latest occurrences of the selected message.

This is current functionality of the tool that it shows additional logs only for error responses.

Our suggestion is to review and implement one of log providers and send data to provider via Log connector. Documentation: Log connector

entry.title: Re: Understanding ABAP Pipeline Engine used for Data Integration in Datasphere
entry.content:
/1DH/CDC_RLFW_SWITCH_RUNNING is likely used by the CDC engine in SAP to control or signal that the replication flow (RLFW) is in a “switch-over” or “resuming” state, probably after downtime.

Look for jobs named /1DH/CDC_RLFW_SWITCH_RUNNING in transaction SM37 (perhaps filtered by day or system restarts).

If found, look at the job steps, start times, and outcomes.

Regards.

David

entry.title: Re: The description of the cost center are not displayed.
entry.content:
Hello @suyoung_choi3 

That is correct; the Custom Cost Center Hierarchies  Manage Global Hierarchies, F2918 support Valid From/To, allowing you to time-slice them. The default standard hierarchy “1” does not have a configurable validity period; only the cost center assignments within it can be modified.

Does it answer your question?

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP MDG: Validation - Notes Mandatory
entry.content:
Hi SCN Folks, 

Hope you guys are doing great 🙂

Note 01: This blog does not include execution screenshots.
Note 02: The entire code was developed and validated in the SANDBOX system, with results meeting expectations.

This post outlines a custom development approach in SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) to enforce mandatory entry of Notes during master data processes. The validation logic is implemented using the enhancement framework via:
BADI:USMD_RULE_SERVICE, specifically through the method CHECK_ENTITY.

This ensures that users provide the required notes, thereby improving data completeness, auditability, and compliance during master data creation and change activities.

Code:

DATA:
  lv_cr_number TYPE usmd_crequest,
  lv_crtype    TYPE usmd_crequest_type,
  lv_process   TYPE usmd_process.

DATA(lo_context) = cl_usmd_app_context=>get_context( ).

IF lo_context IS BOUND.
  CALL METHOD lo_context->get_attributes
    IMPORTING
      ev_crequest_id   = lv_cr_number
      ev_crequest_type = lv_crtype
      ev_process       = lv_process.
ENDIF.

IF lv_crtype EQ 'ZSUCRTYPE'.
  DATA(lv_s_notes) = cl_usmd_conv_som_gov_api=>get_instance( )->get_notes( ).
       IF lv_s_notes IS INITIAL.
          APPEND cl_usmd_message=>convert_text2_message(
          EXPORTING
          iv_message_text = 'Please Maintain Notes, It's Mandatory !!!'.
          iv_message_type = 'E' ) to et_message.
       ENDIF.
ENDIF.

 

SAP S/4HANA SAP Master Data Governance ABAP Development 

Thank You, 
Sandeep Suggu.
SAP Community Profile | SAP Profile | LinkedIn

entry.title: 🟡 Fun for Week 2: Petoberfest 🐱🐶🐵🐷🐻🐸🐔🐴🦬🦎🐠🦜🐧🐌🐛
entry.content:
Welcome to Petoberfest, a traditional of Devtoberfest when you get a chance to show off your beloved pet hamster, cat, iguana, dog or whatever your pet is.

  • 👉Post a picture of your pet.
  • 👉Do not have a living, breathing pet? Upload a picture of your favorite neighbor's pet, or your favorite stuffed animal, or your favorite zoo animal, or any animal that tickles your fancy. Just participate!
  • 👉You can also upload a picture of you participating in any animal welfare activity (more on World Animal Day, below).

Here's my dog, Pepper, begging for food and enjoying a day at the beach.

   

It wouldn't be anything without AI

And just to make it a little bit more interesting, upload a picture of your pet, then use the picture with any generative AI tool to create your pet doing something fun: like ....

  • Doing your SAP programming work
  • Flying to save the day
  • Sipping a pina colada on the beach
  • ... or whatever you think of.

Be creative, in what your pet is doing, as well as the style of the image.

Here's Pepper expressing her love for SAP Build and helping me create my Devtoberfest Cryptic Crossword (she really does help me).

But I'm sure you can be much more creative.

World Animal Day

Petoberfest coincides with World Animal Day (Oct. 4), which "exists to raise the status of animals and improve welfare standards around the globe". 

According to the World Animal Day group in Cheltenham, Gloucestershire::

It’s a day for all animal lovers near and far.  Through organised events, big and small,  we raise awareness of how animals are treated globally. We rally together organisations, children’s groups, schools, clubs, companies, communities and individuals to show we care deeply about animals.

One way you can show you care about animals is to post a picture of your pet, or a picture of any activity you participate in to help the welfare of animals.

Point, Points, Points

Everyone who posts images of their pets will receive 1000 points toward the Devtoberfest grand prize.

So post today, and comment and like the other community members' posts.

entry.title: Top Reasons to Modernize with SAP HANA Cloud – Blog #5 in the Series
entry.content:
This is the final chapter in this blog series on the benefits of migrating to SAP HANA Cloud. In each blog, I’ve described key features that offer significant benefits for your organization and can help you build your business case for SAP HANA Cloud.

Although it can be difficult calculating the business value of migrating your database to the cloud, the expertise of independent organizations can be helpful. A recent IDC study[1]  used a specialized business value methodology to assess the benefits of SAP HANA Cloud delivered to participating organizations. IDC concluded that the benefits were worth an annual average of US$13.7 million per organization and that the database enabled a 35% three-year reduction in total cost of ownership.

If you don’t have time to read this report, I encourage you to complete your own organization assessment using our free tool. In less than five minutes, you’ll receive useful insights that can help you decide your next steps.

 

Let’s consider two more features of SAP HANA Cloud that can help you realize significant business value: comprehensive security and a complete application development ecosystem.

Comprehensive security

Protecting your data and helping ensure compliance are top concerns for every organization. As business operations and workforces become more distributed, the need to provide secure data access from anywhere in the world intensifies.

SAP HANA Cloud offers robust security features that cover critical data protection areas, including authentication, authorization, user management, data masking, anonymization, and encryption. Because these features are built into the database, you have little or no need for third-party security tools. These capabilities also reduce the administrative effort needed to protect data.

Support for multiple security certifications and standards, such as ISO (International Organization for Standardization) and SOC (Standard Occupational Classification), helps ensure regulatory compliance. Configurable audit policies streamline compliance activities while helping protect your business and your customers. Automated updates to libraries and applications also boost security.

These features help make it faster and simpler to meet your security goals. According to the IDC report, the security teams of organizations that deployed SAP HANA Cloud increased efficiency by 19%. This benefit translates into an average annual business value of $183,016 per organization.

One study participant from the agriculture industry cited the database security standards and policies of SAP HANA Cloud, considering it an extra protective layer to reinforce security. “If we had an on-premises database, we’d lack this added protection,” said the interviewee. “The entire platform has policies that prevent mistakes. For instance, SAP now requires updates to libraries and applications for security reasons. These requirements from SAP keep us updated and secure.”

Another participant from the healthcare industry viewed the advanced protection as a financial advantage. “SAP HANA Cloud is a much more secure system that makes data more accessible and applications perform faster,” he said. “This has helped us meet our customers’ needs much better and has improved our revenue by about five percent.”

A complete application development ecosystem

Time and resources are tight for your development teams. Demand from business users has never been higher, new use cases are emerging, and the need for different developer skill sets seems to continually grow.

SAP HANA Cloud can help address these challenges with an integrated development ecosystem based on SAP Build solutions. SAP Build offers a comprehensive group of tools that support the full spectrum of no-code/low-code, pro-code, and generative AI development approaches. With SAP Build and SAP HANA Cloud, you can support developers at any skill level with the right tools.

Developers can build intelligent applications that use generative AI and harness their expertise and data. Applications built on SAP HANA Cloud can use intelligent algorithms to process large volumes of data and provide actionable recommendations. SAP HANA Cloud also includes machine learning libraries that help developers build sophisticated analytics applications that augment user expertise. By incorporating AI-driven insights, these applications help you anticipate future trends and predict behaviors, make business decisions faster, and improve business performance.

The IDC report found that these application development capabilities deliver quantifiable business value. IDC estimates that development team productivity spiked by 30% in the surveyed organizations, creating staff time savings of $361,519 per organization.  

SAP HANA Cloud features, such as information libraries, combined with faster performance and easier integrations, helped developers build more complex applications such as those using machine learning and AI. Overall, participants developed or deployed 154% more features and applications annually than they could without SAP HANA Cloud.

One study participant explained the impact of this value on the development team. “SAP HANA Cloud provides developers with more seamless integrations, and it is easy to use,” the interviewee explained. “They spend less time writing code because they can reuse code and use the libraries.”

 

Explore additional SAP HANA Cloud resources

As we’ve seen in this , the advanced features of SAP HANA Cloud offer significant value for organizations like yours. To help you make your business case for SAP HANA Cloud, check out the following resources:

  • What’s the potential value of SAP HANA Cloud for your organization? Complete a short assessment. 
  • Learn more about SAP HANA Cloud.
  • Discover how moving to SAP HANA Cloud helps you create a foundation for modernization.
  • Explore this guide on building a compelling business case to move your database to the cloud.

 

[1] “The Business Value of SAP HANA Cloud,” IDC, sponsored by SAP, April 2025.

entry.title: Re: Is DRC worth to learn
entry.content:
Hi @Mers 
Thanks @iprieto for sharing your insight and also the link.
Here are some additonal learning material: 

  •  Introducing SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
    After completing this lesson, you will be able to:
    • Explain the end-to-end process flow and SAP Document and Reporting Compliance from end user perspective
    • Distinguish the different deployment options for SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
    • Describe the high level architecture of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
    • Outline what a compliance task is, and which ones are supported by SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
  • SAP Document and Reporting Compliance - Statutory Reporting leanring jounrey and leanr to master the skills needed to implement and customize features of SAP S/4HANA for advanced compliance reporting (Valid for SAP S/4HANA OP, SAP S/4HANA Cloud (public), private and extended editions)
  • Please access in our SAP Discovery Center  the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, electronic document error handling  page to get easy-to-understand explanations for electronic document errors with Joule.
  • Please access in our SAP Help  Center the  SAP Document and Reporting Compliance page  to learn more 

Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: Connection between Process Insight and S/4HANA. Error 443 failed: NIECONN_REFUSED(-10)
entry.content:
I am setting up the connection between Process Insight and S/4HANA, but I am getting the following error:

Direct connect to XXXXX:443 failed: NIECONN_REFUSED(-10)

I understand that the error is likely caused by the proxy connection not being configured yet. I am missing the Proxy Host and Proxy Service information. Could you please advise where I can obtain the system connection details needed to configure this properly?

entry.title: Re: SAP S4 Finance
entry.content:
Hi @manichemi1 ,

StepActionTransaction / AppDetails / Notes
1Check user tolerance groupSU01Select user → Company Code Data → Tolerance Group assigned to user.
2Maintain tolerance amounts for company codeOBA3 (G/L Tolerance Groups) or OBAR / F110 (Payment Tolerances)Select the tolerance group → enter maximum debit/credit differences or over/underpayment amounts → Save.
3Re-run posting/paymentTransaction where error occurredAfter maintaining tolerances, posting/payment should process successfully.

Summary:-
- Tolerance groups are user + company code specific.
- Amounts can be absolute or percentage.
- Ensure the correct user and company code are configured.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: How to identify in debugging that document posted is...
entry.content: I checked the field I_RBKPV-INV_TRAN, but it appears to be blank for both credit memos and invoices. However, I noticed that the field I_RBKPV-XRECH contains the value 'X' for invoices and is blank for credit memos. Additionally, there are two other fields: I_RBKPV-XRECHL and I_RBKPV-XRECHR, where I observed the value 'S' for invoices and 'H' for credit memos. Can these fields be considered reliable indicators to distinguish between invoices and credit memos?

entry.title: Re: Service organization missing some plants
entry.content:
Only due to below three reasons, you will have that issue

  1. You have not assigned a company code to the purchasing organization.
  2. You have not maintained a standard purchasing organization or sales organization relationship for the plant.
  3. You have not assigned the sales area to the plant.

If you are sure, all the above are done and still you face the issue, then, I feel, you need to take the help of ABAP, set a break point in the program and see what is the root cause

entry.title: Re: Revenue posting for Usage based billing
entry.content:
Below would be the Diagnostic Checklist

Confirm the billing element in the customer project is correctly configured for usage-based billing. Ensure the contract type (e.g., P007) is mapped to the correct revenue recognition key in SSCUI 103631.

Check the service material used in the usage-based billing document and is it correctly linked to the Service Product Type Mapping (SPTM)? Is the material extended to the relevant org units in Development?

Validate that the revenue recognition key is assigned to the billing element and is active in Development. Compare this setup with Starter system to spot discrepancies.

Even for usage-based billing, cost rates must be maintained in Manage Cost Rates – Professional Services. Missing or zero cost rates can block revenue postings.

Check if Event-Based Revenue Recognition is enabled for the relevant service documents and project types. Use SSCUI 103631 and 104045 to verify derivation logic and account determination.

After running EBRR jobs, use Display Journal Entries and Revenue Recognition (Event-Based) – Line Items to check. Are there any failed postings? Are entries skipped due to missing configuration?

entry.title: How to withdraw the approval request of a sales order without charge
entry.content:
Dear,

We would like to request guidance on how to withdraw approval for a Sales Order Without Charge.

Thank you for your support.
Best regards.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to withdraw the approval request of a sales order...
entry.content:
Hello,

There are two possibilities for withdrawing an approval request for a sales order of type CBFD - Sales Order Without Charge:

  • Using the app Manage Sales Orders Without Charge - Version 2 (ID: F2305A): the button for withdrawing the approval request can be seen on the top-right corner.
  • Using the app Display Sales Documents (VA03): it's possible to withdraw the approval request via menu > edit > additional functions > withdraw approval request.

For other types of documents, the app Display Sales Documents functions on the same way, and the manage version 2 app for the document type can also be used, for example:

  • Sales Order > Manage Sales Orders - version 2
  • Credit Memo Request > Manage Credit Memo Requests - version 2

Kind regards.

entry.title: Re: SAP MDG: Validation - Notes Mandatory
entry.content:
Several syntax errors: convert_text2_message doesn't exist but convert_text2message exists, the quote should be doubled for "it's", the dot after !!! should be removed, like this:

      APPEND cl_usmd_message=>convert_text2message(
          iv_message_text = 'Please Maintain Notes, It''s Mandatory !!!'
          iv_message_type = 'E' ) TO et_message.
